intro: I wake up at home, exactly at 8:15.

I eat a bowl of oatmeal for breakfast.
The oatmeal is like my life:
beige, bland, and boring.
And then I take the bus to work.
bus:
It's sprinkling lightly.
I hope the bus seats won't be damp.
boss:
My boss says good morning,
then assigns me work for the day.

Recently I've been manually
entering data into spreadsheets.

I glace out the window,
toward the small park off to the right.
Despite working here for 4 years,
 I've never once gone to that park.

I sigh and get back to my work.
The day drags by...
Time to go home. (To the left)
water:
After a long day
I'm ready to go to bed.

Rain continues falling outside
gently lulling me to sleep.

I slowly fall into slumber,
and begin to dream.
waterAlarm:
My alarm clock begins to ring
waking me from my strange dream.
bus2:
As I get on the bus,
I notice a woman and
 her child sitting in front of me.

The child appears
 to be talking to an
imaginary friend named Barth.

It reminds me of how imaginative
 I used to be as a child.

One of my favorite games involved
pretending that the floor had turned into lava.

But now, my life is so mundane and dull.
I can't think of the last time
I imagined anything.
boss2:
My boss says good morning,
then assigns me work for the day.

Once again, I'm manually
entering data into spreadsheets.

For a moment, I think of the
innocence of my childhood.
But of course, nothing innocent can ever last.

I sigh and get back to my work.
The day drags by...
Time to go home. (To the left)
lava: Once again, I drift off into dreamland.

As I slip away,
I think once more about
the imaginative child I used to be.
